title.narrative: Full WASH Services in Jed'ah Camp,Qayyarah district,Ninewa governorate of Iraq

description.narrative:
The proposed project--Emergency WASH intervention for IDPs within the Nineveh Governroate (Zone West Mosul Response Plan)--seeks to address WASH needs sparked by the conflict against the Islamic State in the Nineveh Governorate. Due to the military operations against IS, humanitarian actors expect that up to 800,000 people will be displaced. The population movements and conflict have put stress on WASH services, creating major gaps across the area. The following proposal addresses these gaps in two settings, in camp. The proposal parts are as follows: (1) the in camp intervention is providing WASH services gap in Jed'ah Camp while constructing additional WASH structures as the MODM WASH blocks are often unsanitary and below Sphere standards. This proposal will reaches 36000 individuals (IDPs).
The overall goals of the intervention are as follows: -Facilitate safe access to emergency water and sanitation services and hygiene practices for highly vulnerable populations in camp settings.
(1) RNVDO's intervention in Jed'ah Camp is as follows: -The project is a camp-based, first-line/second-line response. -Reaches 36,000 individuals in Jed'ah Camp. -Water is delivered will be delivered at a rate of 25 liters per person per day, which is in line with WASH Response against Settlement Typology Guidelines. -The services and resources delivered will be in line with those laid out in the WASH Response against Settlement Typology Guidelines for camp settings. -The services will include garbage collection, de-sludging, maintenance, WASH block cleaning, WASH block construction, hygiene kit distribution, and water trucking. -Delivery of 6,000 hygiene kits per month. -WASH structure rehabilitation/construction, which includes connection to cesspools, installation of privacy screens around the WASH blocks for women to prevent sexual harassment, and other needed repairs.
The overall goals of the intervention are as follows: -Facilitate safe access to emergency water and sanitation services and hygiene practices for highly vulnerable populations in camp settings. -Expand coverage of water and sanitation services and hygiene practices in camp settings. -Work with camp management to develop an exit strategy and engage communities. This includes but is not limited to increasing WASH committee activities and partnering with local government.
Protection issues will be taken into consideration through intervention design.
